comment.author: 7259248@N03
comment._content: The spelling of a lot of these place names seems to be German.  In Danish: Fredriksborg Slot

comment.author: 31419719@N00
comment._content: Actually it's now "Frederiksborg Slot, Hillerød, Denmark", but when the picture was taken, the spelling in this picture could very well have been correct. I live just 1500 meters from here, and my grandfather used to work as a gardener in the park around the castle. He lived in a little house just outside the frame of this picture. Frederiksborg Castle isn't situated in Copenhagen, but in Hillerød, approximately 35 km from the center of Copenhagen. It is now a museum where you can see a large collection of historic paintings.

comment.author: 24736216@N07
comment._content:
I was at Fredericksborg some years ago, and I found the museum very interesting.  With each room, you advanced about 10 years in Danish history.  

Of course you are correct, Jesper.  It is Hillerød, not Copenhagen.  

I have a later view of this photo.  It will have to wait a few days, until I post the set on Flickr.
